function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential reliance on sewage tracking for disease severity assessment may overlook unrepresented cases in the community","Impact":"Inaccuracy in assessing the severity of the epidemic and potential underestimation of the disease spread","Mitigation":"Complement sewage tracking with other epidemiological surveillance methods to capture unrepresented cases in the community","Technologies":"Advanced data analytics, machine learning, and integrated sensor systems for comprehensive disease tracking","People":"Public health authorities, epidemiologists, and researchers","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions"},{"Description":"Digital technology extracting intimate health information from water and wastewater-related services","Impact":"Privacy concerns, potential misuse of personal health data, and ethical implications","Mitigation":"Implement stringent data privacy regulations, encryption techniques, and secure data handling protocols","Technologies":"Data encryption, secure data storage and transmission, and privacy-enhancing technologies","People":"General public, data protection authorities, and policymakers","Owner":"Regulatory bodies, technology companies, and policymakers"},{"Description":"Blurred boundaries between water services and public health","Impact":"Confusion in accountability and responsibility for public health management, potential gaps in disease surveillance and response","Mitigation":"Establish clear regulatory frameworks and collaborative governance structures for integrated water and public health management","Technologies":"Interoperable data systems, integrated management platforms, and governance and accountability tools","People":"Water utilities, public health agencies, and regulatory authorities","Owner":"Regulatory bodies, public health agencies, and water management organizations"}]}
